rename.from: Latest rclone FTP backend hangs when transferring files to
rename.to: Latest rclone FTP backend hangs when transferring multiple files from Azure FTPS

rename.from: Latest rclone FTP backend hangs when transferring multiple files from Azure FTPS
rename.to: rclone FTP backend hangs when transferring multiple files from Azure FTPS

rename.from: rclone FTP backend hangs when transferring multiple files from Azure FTPS
rename.to: FTP backend hangs when transferring multiple files from Azure FTPS

body:
> concurrency = 3

This has been the cause of no end of deadlocks in the FTP backend!

Make sure that `--checkers` + `--transfers` < `concurrency`, so in your case use `--checkers 1` `--transfers 1` and it will probably be OK.

I did try `concurrency = 1` without success

I haven't tried checkers / transfers though, I'll take a look shortly

It's having concurrency too low which causes the deadlocks.

Using --check-first is a good idea also as well as --checkers and --transfers as rclone the won't do the two phases concurrently

Bingo - `--checkers 1 --transfers 1` worked - I tried just `--check-first` but that didn't seem to change anything on its own

Did something change in the defaults between 1.52.0 and 1.57.0? I mostly raised this issue as I fought with concurrency issues for ages back in 1.52.0 until it was stable, assuming that it was an issue on Azure's end, and was surprised when this broke again.

Does it make sense to force --checkers and --transfers to be < concurrency? Or even just print a warning if it's detected that they're not?

[Azure confirms that they're limited to 3 concurrent connections for FTP transfers](https://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/en-US/61532ef2-d3d8-4151-bcdf-c4c2dc144197/is-there-an-ftp-connection-limit-to-azure-web-apps?forum=windowsazurewebsitespreview) to/from App Services, so this seems like a potentially common use case.

Interestingly, `--checkers 3 --transfers 3 --check-first` still hangs.

I would have thought `--check-first` would free those first 3 connections up once done?

> Interestingly, `--checkers 3 --transfers 3 --check-first` still hangs.

Try `--checkers 2 --transfers 2 --check-first` to leave a spare connection - that is what I usually advise.

> I would have thought `--check-first` would free those first 3 connections up once done?

It should do yes...

If you want to see exactly what rclone is deadlocked on then kill it with SIGQUIT or `CTRL-\` and it will print a backtrace. If you post that here, I'll analyse it for you.

> Try `--checkers 2 --transfers 2 --check-first` to leave a spare connection - that is what I usually advise.

This worked perfectly

Here's the backtrace if it helps improve the product - at this point I'm happy to close the issue as resolved with the feature suggestion to include a warning RE concurrency vs checkers / transfers

```

- go/tags: none
```

I think what happens is that an extra connection is needed after the transfer to set the modification time, but the connection for the transfer hasn't been released at that point.

I've added some notes to the docs about this which I'll merge in a bit!
